intro: Obaejaca viscosa, commonly known as the sticky obeeja, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that produce a sticky substance, which is used by indigenous peoples for various purposes. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Obaejaca viscosa typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and absorbing moisture from the air. Its flowers are showy and often attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
